title.narrative: Life-saving emergency livelihood support to flood- affected agro-pastoralist communities in Unity State

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide emergency livelihood support to mitigate the impact of projected floods on the food security and livelihoods of agro-pastoralist communities in Unity State. This FAO project protects livestock assets by treating and vaccinating animals and by working with affected communities to dispose of animal carcasses as a way of preventing water contamination and the spread of zoonotic diseases. The project provides agriculture assistance to 60,000 people, including 12,000 men 12,000 women, 18,000 girls, 18,000 boys and 600 people with disabilities.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS SOUTH SUDAN RAPID RESPONSE FLOOD 2022

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Livestock assets of agro-pastoralists protected against priority animal diseases.

Ag.2 Number of animals vaccinated, dewormed and/or treated (Output)180 000 animals vaccinated by week 12 and a total of 300 000 by week 24. 10 000 animals dewormed or treated by week 12 and a total of 30 000 by week 24

Cash.3b Total value of conditional cash transfers distributed in USD
FS.5a Percentage of households with an acceptable food consumption score (outcome) 35% (3 500 households) with acceptable food consumption score
